Experience: ['Shift: Full time, DaysUnder the direction of the Strategic Marketing Manager, the Marketing Communications Associate will provide a full range of support services to the Marketing Communications department to meet department and organizational objectives. Provides full administrative support including answering department phone, ordering office supplies, managing invoices and contracts, and other administrative duties as assigned. Develops a variety of marketing communications materials that support business objectives within budgeted guidelines; utilizes graphic design software to develop and create letters, seminar/event flyers and posters for physician outreach and other assigned client departments. Works with marketing team members to maintain an up-to-date fiscal year marketing promotions calendar; maintains project production schedules and follows-up with marketing team members to support the team with meeting scheduled deadlines. Leads special event planning (i.e., Physician and community meetings, community events and health fairs); attends events to organize and direct support activities such as set-up, registration, etc. Orders, reviews and assures inventory and quality of all NCH collateral material and branded premium items. Negotiates and selects vendors. Tracks budget and ensures purchases are made within budgetary limits. Handles and/or participates in special projects as assigned. Adheres to all Northwest Community Hospital standards, policies, and procedures. Bachelor’s Degree in English, Journalism, Marketing, Public Relations or any other Marketing or Communications related field required. 1 year of relevant business experience preferred. Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Power Point, Outlook, Word and Excel, required. Knowledge or experience with graphic design software a plus. Excellent verbal communication and interpersonal skills necessary to interact effectively with all levels of the hospital staff, physicians and external customers. The written communication skills necessary to effectively develop Marketing communications materials including letters, flyers and posters. Organization skills necessary to coordinate and execute multiple projects while maintaining established deadlines. Availability to work evenings or weekends for special events as required. Ability to remain flexible as work load and priorities can change very rapidly. Access to an automobile and a valid Illinois driver’s licensePrimary LocationUnited States-Illinois-Arlington HeightsWork Locations800 W Central - HospitalJobOffice/ClericalShiftDay JobEmployee StatusRegular']

["We are a fast-growing, full-service commercial real estate firm with an amazing reputation as a Top Workplace in Crain’s Chicago Business as well as Chicago Tribune.Description:Marketing Coordinators are charged with all administrative and coordination of marketing efforts for commercial real estate brokerage teams, demonstrating strong project management skills and proactivity. They should be proficient in all key Microsoft applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook) and Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator and Acrobat).\xa0Core Responsibilities:Assisting commercial real estate brokers and brokerage teams with developing and tracking marketing materials, presentations, proposals, electronic marketing campaigns, and strategic plans for properties being leased or soldDesign and update listing marketing materialsCoordinate and execute mass direct mail campaignsRegularly creates and distributes property listing information, invitations, announcements, etc. via emailMaintain team websites, bios and social media outletEvent coordination for client/tenant/company eventsIdentifies opportunities and collaborates with Marketing DepartmentResearch and database experienceUpholds company brand standards and guidelines when working on projectsAdditional general office support including written correspondence, answering phones, mail duties, etc.Attends department meetings regularly and contributes to improvement of department\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Position Requirements:Bachelor's Degree or commensurate experienceCommercial Real Estate experience preferredWorkplace experience, minimum of 4 years in administrative support role – a fast-paced work environment preferred, team playerUnderstanding of Social Media networks (Twitter, LinkedIn)Knowledge of the following programs is a plus: Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator), Regis, CoStar, Loopnet, Constant Contact, Google EarthHours are 8:30-5:00 Monday through\xa0Friday"]

['Job Title: Online Marketing Manager Duration: Direct Hire / Full-Time Location: Northwestern Suburbs  Salary: 70,000 - $80,000, Depending on Experience  Our retail client is looking for a Online Marketing Manager to join their team on a Full-Time basis.  The team is a tight knit group and looking for someone who can champion marketing efforts within the digital landscape; with focus on ecommerce, website, email and paid search channels.  Online Marketing Manager Responsibilities: \xa0- Establish channel content marketing strategy and manage execution for multiple brands\xa0- Ecommerce Management: Manage product catalog and promotions in Magneto; track success\xa0- Develop strategy and make recommendations for website, e-mail and paid search campaigns consisting of PPC, Google AdWords, Display\xa0- Optimize programs in place for SEO, SMS, Social Media\xa0- Website: content management and optimizations\xa0- Develop competitive and consumer trends analysis \xa0- Potential to manage small team of junior level marketing staff (based on experience in people management)  Online Marketing Manager Requirements:\xa0- Ideally 5+ years marketing experience\xa0- Demonstrated understanding of digital and eCommerce strategy and execution\xa0- Proficient in Wordpress or similar CMS (Webflow a PLUS)\xa0- Experience managing Google AdWords and Analytics \xa0- Experience working within e-commerce + emails platforms\xa0- Experience with Tableau a PLUS']

A workplace recognized as the Startup of the Yearzaeeuqaxrwuybbuwdavye by Built in Chicago, a Top Workplace by Chicago Tribune, and one of Chicago’s Best Places to Work for Women Under 35 by Crain’s Chicago Business.Classification Of Protected Categories Is As FollowsIf you believe you belong to any of the categories of protected veterans listed below, please indicate by making the appropriate selection. As a government contractor subject to Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA), we request this information in order to measure the effectiveness of the outreach and positive recruitment efforts we undertake pursuant to VEVRAA.A "disabled veteran" is one of the following: a veteran of the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs; or a person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability.A "recently separated veteran" means any veteran during the three-year period beginning on the date of such veteran\'s discharge or release from active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval, or air service.An "active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran" means a veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war, or in a campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense.An "Armed forces service medal veteran" means a veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985.Form CC-305OMB Control Number 1250-0005Expires 1/31/2020Because we do business with the government, we must reach out to, hire, and provide equal opportunity to qualified people with disabilities1. To help us measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or if you ever had a disability. Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you will choose to fill it out. If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way.If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way. Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our employees to update their information every five years. You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier.You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition.Disabilities Include, But Are Not Limited To Blindness  Deafness  Cancer  Diabetes  Epilepsy  Autism  Cerebral palsy  HIV/AIDS  Schizophrenia  Muscular dystrophy  Bipolar disorder  Major depression  Multiple sclerosis (MS)  Missing limbs or partially missing limbs  Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)  Obsessive compulsive disorder  Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair  Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation)Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.1Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. For more information about this form or the equal employment obligations of Federal contractors, visit the U.S. Department of Labor\'s Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) website at www.dol.gov/ofccp.PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. This survey should take about 5 minutes to complete.']

['Account Executive, Partnership MarketingDescription:In the last few years The Chicago Bulls Partnership Marketing department has developed a customized approach to client management that uses strategy engrained in consumer insights to build one-of-a-kind, immersive partnerships that authentically engage consumers across all channels. The new approach supports cross-departmental participation to develop mutually beneficial content and activations that move the needle on client goals and objectives.Our team is growing, and we are looking to add a full-time Partnership Marketing Coordinator this season. In this role, you will be responsible for managing and executing contractual obligations and service requests for the team’s Corporate Partners. You will manage a set number of team partnership accounts with a variety of assets which include both in and out of arena components. In addition, you will provide hospitality services to clients and assist with Corporate Partnership events and programs.The person who fills this role will be a talented communicator and connector, who serves as the correspondent between the Bulls and the client in an authentic, trusted and engaging way. They will thrive in a fast paced, ever-changing environment, and be a strategic brand and experiential marketing natural. They will also be a trusted ally who listens to, and strategizes with internal Bulls teammates to achieve strategic client objectives.Key Responsibilities: Build and maintain strong and trusting relationships with roster of clients and establish his/herself as a trusted strategic business partner Execute all contractual obligations while providing the highest level of hospitality and service in a timely manner Lead client facing messaging and meetings that yield clear next steps and deliverables to keep all parties progressing Lead day-to-day client communication, project development and execution, and teardown Lead internal cross-functional meetings that yield clear next steps and deliverables to keep all parties progressing Recommend strategic partnership adjustments based on consumer experience strategy to ensure contractual assets continue to align with team and client goals Maintain the highest level of professionalism when representing the Chicago Bulls, United Center and team partners  Preferred Skillset Great teammate with positive energy, who has a drive for learning Thrives in a dynamic work environment, displays strong work ethic, and gets the job done while enjoying it along the way Strong and engaging written and verbal communication style with a knack for presenting ideas clearly and concisely An innate problem solver who can anticipate obstacles and create solutions in a timely manner Strong attention to detail with the ability to prioritize and has impeccable follow through Demonstrates an understanding for the sports industry, business trends and consumer habits Demonstrates an ability to empathize with client’s consumer, and actively tracks their behavior to inform strategic brand planning and execution Embodies and reflects Bulls’ collaborative-based culture and commits him/herself and team to the highest standards Works effectively with cross-functional teams to deliver executional excellence  Qualification Requirements: Minimum of 1-2 years consumer marketing, relevant agency experience, and/or directly related professional team experience BA/BS in Marketing related field is preferred Agency and experiential marketing experience strongly preferred Flexible schedule with ability to work nights and weekends, as the schedule requires We are an Equal Opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.']

['WHO ARE WE? Avison Young is the world’s fastest-growing commercial real estate services firm, with approximately 5,000 employees in 120 offices in 20 countries providing investment sales, leasing, advisory, management and financing services to clients across the office, retail, industrial, multifamily and hospitality sectors around the world.  WHO YOU ARE? We’re seeking a digital marketing specialist to join our growing global marketing team. In this newly created position, the Director of Digital Marketing – Global will help develop and manage digital marketing initiatives and channels, and oversee website content, SEO initiatives and metrics in collaboration with our global, national and local marketing, research, innovation and IT teams.Role Description Develop and manage Avison Young’s global website strategies, content platform and ancillary websites in conjunction with the global CMO and IT team to ensure a compelling and engaging user experience  Design and execute digital marketing strategies initiatives, including landing pages, social media, email marketing, online advertising, SEO and content strategies and video, working with vendors and internal teams as needed  Map, analyse and optimize the client journey across all digital channels, in close collaboration with client and marketing functions, to improve lead generation and goal conversion  Develop policies, best practice and a support offices, countries and team in recommending and implementation of web strategies for their local and target markets and objectives  Develop and manage email marketing strategies, campaigns and projects to drive business development and brand recognition  Serve as internal subject-matter expert for digital marketing - providing and developing information/content for stakeholders and marketers across the organization  Provide competitive intelligence and insights as well as monitoring emerging trends and their application to our digital marketing suite of tools  As part of the digital working group, and in partnership with communications, CRM and IT, evaluate the business-wide technology ecosystem to develop, shape and drive digital marketing strategy  Partner with our Innovation to maximize exposure of firm’s lease and sales listings in dynamic customer-facing manner  Work with Research and Innovation teams to evolve the way we communicate with our clients around the real estate market and the firm’s intelligence around the marketQualIFICATIONS Minimum 10+ years managing digital content and campaigns, sites, social media, mobile, lead generation and/or marketing programs, preferably in professional services or CRE environment  Understanding of digital best practices, including visual design, CMS, HTML, front-end development, usability, information architecture, technology standards and content administration  Understanding of email marketing, blog and content management best practices – Pardot experience would be an advantage  Strong organizational, analytical and verbal and written communication skills  Familiarity with application development process  Knowledge of Google Analytics, Google AdWords and Webmaster tools  Ability to flourish in collaborative, fast-paced environment  BA/BS degree in marketing or relevant field Our Equal Opportunity Commitment Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world. We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity.The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law.For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!']

Job Title: Director of Marketing, Demand Generation - Chicago
Experience: ['Our Company Is In An Enviable Spot.We’re profitable, and both our bottom line and our global reach are growing rapidly. We’re playing in an exploding market where technology evolves daily and new solutions / innovations are created left and right. We’ve got a stellar, strategic management team who find joy in working together and are executing effectively across the board.A Few Things To Know About Us  We put our customers first.  When making decisions, we always seek to do what is right for our customer first, our company second, our teams third, and individual selves last.    We do things differently.  As a pioneer in a highly-competitive industry that is poised to reshape every sector of the global economy, we cannot fall back on old models. Rather, we must chart our own path and strive to out-innovate, out-maneuver and out-pace the competition on the way.    We walk the walk on diversity.  We’re a brilliant and eclectic mix of ethnicities, religions, industry experiences, sexual orientations, generations and more – and that’s by design. We see diverse perspectives as a core competitive advantage.    Integrity is essential.  We believe in doing things well – and doing them right. Integrity is a core value here: you’ll see it embodied in our staff, our management approach and growing social impact work (we have a VP devoted to it). You’ll also see it embodied in the way we manage people and our HR issues: we expect employees and managers to deal with issues directly, immediately and with the utmost respect for each other and for the Company. No politics. No gossip. No bureaucratic third parties required.    We are owners.  Strong managers enable and empower their teams to figure out how to solve problems. You will be no exception, and will have the ownership, accountability and autonomy needed to be truly creative. Be a part of a team of innovators in the IoT and M2M space and a company that is profitable and growing rapidly. We’re looking for strategic and visionary demand generation / marketing leader. This is an ideal opportunity for an individual who is eager to roll up their sleeves and take ownership of a critical marketing function and evangelize the Aeris IoT solutions. So this is where you come in!The  Director of Demand Generation  will take ownership of one of our key geographical regions (North America, Europe or APAC) to generate demand for our IoT enterprise business teams. Responsibilities include working with marketing automation and CRM systems to manage lead input, track campaign results, analyze data, and improve processes. A deep understanding of best practices in the capture, tracking, qualifying, segmenting and reporting on leads is essential.The ideal candidate must be self-directed, a tenacious problem-solver, collaborate well with colleagues, take initiative, and manage numerous projects simultaneously. In this role, attention to detail is critical. We are looking for someone with critical thinking skills who can dive into the details to get things done with a “can do” attitude. Expertise in Marketing Automation (preferably HubSpot) is a requirement, knowledge of NetSuite is a plus. This role is currently an independent contributor role, but manages one full-time vendor as well as an array of additional vendors and contractors, and the candidate must be a good fit for a quick transition to a management role.Role And Responsibilities Create campaigns from start to finish, including value prop messaging and targeting analysis  Generate, nurture, qualify and track leads through online campaigns including content marketing, SEO/SEM, webinars, advertising and content syndication   Manage lead nurturing program using HubSpot   Manage direct email marketing campaigns for multiple verticals and buyers in different stages of the funnel but generally very large companies   Establish benchmarks for campaign performance metrics and provide recommendations to increase campaign effectiveness continually   Coordinate with Direct Sales and Partner Sales team to integrate direct marketing programs with sales calling efforts   Manage the global lead database and segmentation   Maintain all direct marketing assets   Test landing pages and emails to improve conversion rates   Create new campaigns and optimize existing campaigns based on campaign results and effectiveness   Manage marketing automation system (currently HubSpot) and utilize NetSuite CRM to track leads in the pipeline   This role will be measured by the number of leads, cost per qualified lead, and most importantly, the % of leads that turn into prospects The Successful Candidate Will Have Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field   Minimum 10 years of experience in B2B marketing with at least 5 years in lead/demand generation, ideally for large companies   Experience with B2B messaging for large, complex sales, as well as creating and marketing to unique Buyer Personas  Strong experience in the full cycle of campaign creation, from messaging development, to execution, to follow up and analysis.   Understanding of audience segmentation and how to apply this to direct marketing and lead nurturing campaigns for complex sales   Experience with lead nurturing and managing a lead nurturing program, preferably in Hubspot  Metrics-driven professional that can also write and optimize copy and design   2 – 3 years of email marketing experience to different vertical segments and large buyers throughout the funnel   Proven experience in monitoring and analyzing data to evaluate program effectiveness using a CRM and other reporting tools, preferably in Hubspot  Minimum of 3 years hands-on, demonstrable experience and proficiency with marketing automation platforms, Google Analytics, and CRM systems   Ability to work independently, manage your priorities, and maintain communication with stakeholders in a fast-paced, dynamic, performance-driven environment   Proficient in Microsoft® ExcelGreat Pluses HubSpot Certified   Experience with NetSuite   Experience in a SaaS-based software industry is preferred   Expertise in Microsoft® Excel, including pivot tables and other advanced capabilitiesAeris walks the walk on diversity. We’re a brilliant mix of varying ethnicities, religions, cultures, sexual orientations, gender identities, ages and professional/personal/military experiences – and that’s by design. Diverse perspectives are essential to our culture, innovative process and competitive edge.Aeris is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.']

Company Name: WorkinEntertainment.com - Jobs in TV, Film, Radio, Music and Media
Experience: ['The Marketing Manager is accountable for driving incremental ticket sales through the creation and implementation of strategic marketing plans for his or her assigned accounts, with a heavy focus on digital media. The Manager delivers the full range of our assets and services, and reinforces Ticketmaster’s Marketing value proposition by:  Deploying our marketing talent, assets and services to help clients sell more tickets;  Collecting data, performing analyses and creating recommendations that separate Ticketmaster from the competition;  Serving as a conduit for sharing best-practices, trends, and synthesizing the experiences of other clients to provide highly valuable idea-starters and improve marketing results; and  Providing related specialty services as we develop them. The Manager is responsive, flexible, results-driven, dynamic, highly collaborative and an excellent communicator. He or she successfully balances strategic and operational roles in an ever-changing environment. Our world is characterized by clients with highly variable needs and periods of intense activity. Understanding these client needs, designing marketing plans customized around them, and communicating effectively are central to the Manager’s success. What the job is:  Maintain knowledge of current industry events and trends, and integrate that knowledge and the implications into marketing strategies.  Leverage a deep understanding of the client’s goals and priorities to develop strategic marketing plans for assigned accounts, with a heavy focus on digital.  Liaise with internal teams to coordinate the successful execution of multi-channel media campaigns.  Evaluate, approve, and execute email marketing campaigns on behalf of the client.  Track all marketing activities at the client, market, regional and national level.  Communicate effectively and frequently with both clients and internal account management people. Client communication needs to be highly professional and persuasive.  Monitor and review campaign performance to help draw conclusions about what approaches deliver the best results.  Secure, test and troubleshoot creative assets across email, display, social, search and video.  Effective, professional written and oral communication skills.  The ability to think “out of the box” in defining and solving problems.  Campaign performance (and other) data analysis, and the ability to develop business intelligence and actionable recommendations from that analysis.  The ability to effectively interact (often in a leadership role) with clients and colleagues across the executive, mid-manager and day-to-day operations levels in a professional, service-oriented manner.  Polished presentation skills, including the ability to clearly articulate the value of Ticketmaster’s marketing assets and services.  The dexterity to successfully manage, in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment, multiple ongoing assignments, unplanned assignments and interruptions, and internal and external requests; and to prioritize and carry out those assignments effectively such that you exceed reasonable internal and external expectations. Our job descriptions evolve with our business need and priorities. In addition to the description above, your role may include additional projects and team support as needed. What a qualified candidate should possess:  BA/BS in Marketing or a related field.  Minimum of three years of experience developing multi-channel marketing campaigns.  Minimum two years of account management experience.  Experience in the live entertainment or music industry.  Proven ability to evaluate reports and data, identify trends and make effective tactical recommendations based on business intelligence.  Strong competence in Microsoft Office products.  Knowledge of popular CRM systems and web analytics tools (e.g., Salesforce, Google Analytics) is a plus.  Ability to use Adobe Photoshop and a basic understanding of HTML are also a plus.  Up to 20% travel required.E']

['Position OverviewThe Marketing Coordinator assists in creating monthly marketing plans, oversee the planning and execution of traveler events, maintains email and direct mailing databases, creates and maintains content for Mayflower social media accounts, writes and proofreads copy for various marketing materials and assists the Director of Marketing with CRM Admin responsibilities. This position reports to the Director of Marketing and work closely with the design, distribution and sales teams, to ensure daily, weekly and monthly marketing tasks are completed while maintaining consistency in messaging and branding.Responsibilities Update and maintain email and direct mail database lists on a regular basis Update and maintain the Mayflower Cruises & Tours website Create copy for Mayflower Cruises & Tours marketing pieces, email marketing campaigns, and social media content Assist with writing and delivery of press releases Assist in creating and updating monthly marketing plans Oversee the planning and execution of various traveler events throughout the year Oversee the ordering of traveler gifts and promotional materials Prepare emails for weekly e-blasts Various administrative duties as neededJob Requirements B.A. in marketing, business, communications or 2 years related experience Strong communications skills Excellent copy-writing and proofreading skills Good project management skills Creative and innovative Drupel and HTML knowledge preferred Computer proficiency with Microsoft Office, including experience with template, macro and customization Salesforce & Pardot product knowledge required Adobe Creative Suite knowledge preferred but not requiredMayflower Cruises & Tours, LLC, is a division of the Scenic Group, located in Lisle, IL. Celebrating 40 years of business in 2019, Mayflower’s mission is to create Life Enriching Experiences and give travelers the trip of a life-time at each and every destination. Since 1979, the team at Mayflower has been providing individual and group guided cruise and tour arrangements within the United States and around the World.']

["What does Packback do?Packback exists to awaken and fuel the fearless, relentless curiosity in every student.We are a social learning platform powered by a proprietary A.I. that college professors use to help their students fall in love with the subject matter, drive personalized learning, and most importantly, quantify and improve critical thinking skills.What it's like to work on the Marketing team?As a 3 person team that services a 50 person revenue org we use agile project management to deliver impactful campaigns and results every two weeks. We strive to foster a collaborative, growth-oriented culture and accept nothing but exceptional performance as a result. As a small team, each individual is expected to contribute to building a world-class marketing function through continuous improvement and to take ownership of the team's performance and success.How will you add value to the team?You will be a key member of the marketing team who is responsible for planning, coordinating, executing and optimizing digital marketing campaigns. You'll help Packback reach new customers through email campaigns, guide leads through the sales process with personalized nurturing, automation, SEO and SEM. You'll build out marketing campaigns using segmentation, creative assets and copy to share the value of Packback with our leads and customers. This role requires a high level of creativity, attention to detail, excellent written communication skills and the ability to handle multiple concurrent projects in a fast-paced environment. Awesome stuff you will do!Plan and execute one-off and drip email engagement programs throughout all phases of the buyer journey to generate conversions (cold prospect, warm lead, hot lead, customer, etc)Strategize and execute digital campaigns across SEO/SEM, website, email and marketing automationCollaborate with marketing teammates to develop the content, copy and segmentation for email campaigns, as well as integrated, cross-channel campaignsManage multiple campaigns simultaneously and make adjustments as needed to optimize results by performing A/B testing with regularity.Measure, monitor and report on campaign performance, deriving insights from data and suggesting improvements to both strategy and tacticsUtilize strong analytical ability to evaluate end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels and customer touchpoints.Contribute to other growth marketing initiatives that generate leads such as conferences and customer activation programsObserve a company growing quickly and grow quickly as an individualWhat You Won't DoFeel like a number - we empower each other and celebrate the small and the big wins, every day. Every single team member makes a direct impact here.Get bored - we thrive off of curiosity and have fun while we do itWhat You Bring To The Table2+ years of professional marketing or related experience.Strong understanding of email marketing and buyer journeyA data-driven and conversion-oriented mindsetAgile and adaptable to changing circumstances or requirements.Highly accountable with ability to handle multiple projects, manage competing priorities and workflowProficiency in Microsoft Excel/Google Sheets and a basic understanding of Marketing AutomationExperience with SEO/SEM, HTML or Adobe Creative Suite a plusBe a lifelong learner - be willing to provide and receive feedback from team members on a regular basis, in a shared effort of furthering our personal and team growthValues fit - the individual must be aligned with all of our company values, but especially as it relates to:We are fearlessly curious.We are radically kind.We do what we say we will do.We never stop moving forward (no matter how small the step)We earn leadership through humility, optimism, and ownership.We employ an investor's mindset.What You Will EnjoyConvenient Loop office (Jackson & Michigan) close to CTA lines, Metra and paid parking lots6 weeks fully paid, gender non-specific extended leave policy (for either parent welcoming a new child through birth or adoption, or to care for a family member in need)Health insurance through BCBS of IL (we cover $250 a month per individual employee!), option for dental, vision and lifeShort-term disability insuranceFlexible vacation policy with a minimum of 10 days recommendedCompetitive salaries and room for professional growth. The base salary for this role is $50k with room to grow!Values-driven culture that encourages transparency and open communicationAnnual paid company offsite retreats and outings.Access to creative and educational events hosted at the Packback officeCasual dress codeOur office pup, Pepper!Note: She is a registered emotional support dog and has become part of our team. With that, we want to respect any and all pet allergies. If you do have dog allergies please let us know right away and we will be sure to put a solution in place.Our Commitment To DiversityWorking in the Education Technology space, Packback believes it is an ethical necessity for us to work to build a diverse and inclusive team, to help us better consider the needs of our diverse audience of students with a wide range of educational backgrounds and educational needs.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.5A8VNUjNe8"]

["DescriptionPosition at Hill+Knowlton StrategiesHill+Knowlton Strategies is seeking a motivated, energetic and highly organized Public Relations Fellow to support the Marketing Communications team in Chicago for immediate start. The Fellow will assist in the execution of high-impact client campaigns, gaining valuable experience to develop strategic communications skills. The fellowship is merely step one toward what will become a fulfilling career for many.Our Chicago office has an experienced team of talented professionals who offer full-service communications support to clients throughout the Midwest, nationally and internationally. ['What is CodeHS?CodeHS is a comprehensive program for helping schools teach computer science. We provide web-based curriculum, teacher tools and resources, and professional development.MissionThe mission of CodeHS is to empower all students to meaningfully impact the future.We believe that in the 21st century, coding is a foundational skill, just like reading and writing. That’s why we say: Read, Write, Code. We do this by providing great curriculum, tools, and resources to teachers, students, and schools to implement high quality computer science programs. We believe that everyone should get the chance to learn coding, and that it’s a skill that provides limitless creative opportunity to students. We want to help make computer science education fun and accessible, and believe you need both great tools as well as a great community to make this happen. We do this through our support for teachers, students and schools, with the help our dedicated team and amazing tutors.Marketing Manager Job DescriptionCodeHS is looking for an Marketing Manager to help grow CodeHS and spread computer science education to more students and more schools. Your primary responsibility will be managing marketing efforts at CodeHS.Responsibilities Manage marketing materials and customer resources Develop email newsletters and run email campaigns Help manage social media channels Help manage industry conferences Create case studies Work on branding and messaging Manage the blog and product and content marketing Make CodeHS more visible to potential schools and teachers Requirements Experience working in marketing Work well independently and autonomously, a self-starter Experience with email marketing Works well in teams Professional and clear at email Extremely organized and detail oriented Passionate about helping students and schools Excited to work at a small company and make a big impact 1-2+ years of professional marketing experience Edtech experience a bonus Experience with design (adobe photoshop/illustrator) preferred Experience with HTML/CSS a plus No experience coding is required, you should have an interest in learning Company ValuesEncourage Teaching and LearningCodeHS is about providing excellent teaching and learning opportunities in computer science for students all over the world. We value creating fun, accessible and creative learning experiences for teachers, for students, and for team members at CodeHS. We believe that education--and specifically coding--within the formal K-12 system, the higher-education system, and beyond has the power to allow everyone to unlock their full potential.Create a Direct Positive ImpactAt CodeHS we value creating a direct positive social impact with our work. We work directly with students, teachers, schools and districts to implement computer science classes. Through building great curriculum, tools and resources to allow high schools to teach computer science, we can create a direct educational benefit to students to help explore the limitless world of computing. We believe that expanding access to computer science education will empower students to take an active role in creating the future.Make It Fun and CreativeBringing fun and creativity to every aspect of our work is a main focus for us at CodeHS. It starts with a fun, friendly and accessible curriculum, that allows students the opportunity to build creatively and engage in thoughtful problem solving. We also focus on developing a creative and fun environment to work in, and think that this allows us to bring novel approaches to challenging problems. Computing is about logic--but it’s also about creativity--and we hope to share that excitement with teachers and students through CodeHS.']

["Job DescriptionTo be the World's Most Loved Children's Brand, we need the best people to join our team! Radio Flyer holds a special place in people's hearts. Working with Marketing team and cross-functional teams, this position will be responsible for the following.Specific Responsibilities Include Develop marketing plans to drive business growth by increasing brand awareness and purchase of new and existing products in all markets around the world.  Lead Communications team to deliver content to support new product launches, radioflyer.com initiatives, packaging artwork, internal communications, social media, and PR outreach.  Partner with Sales to create channel marketing plans, support sales initiatives, implement competitive strategy and drive sales.  Partner with Product Development to identify white space opportunities, create product roadmaps, brief new projects, position products at key customers, manage retail channels and target pricing.  Conduct market research to understand customers, competitors to identify market insights that lead to new business growth (new products, distribution plans, selling channels, brand awareness).Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communication or Business Management  Minimum 8 years experience in Product Marketing and Brand Management  Minimum of 4 years experience leading and developing a team of direct reports  Hands-on, innovative, results oriented leader  Strong decision maker with ability to prioritize complex objectives and meet aggressive timelines  Strong interpersonal skills including the ability to work with a cross-functional teamAbove All, The Individual Must Commit To Our Values F UN-omenal Customer Experiences L ive with Integrity Y es I Can E xcellence in Everything R esponsible for SuccessAt Radio Flyer, we appreciate different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives —encouraging everyone to bring their authentic selves to work. We are committed to employing a diverse workforce and are a proud equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability. Please apply online at  Channel Marketing People Management/LeadershipJob Location Chicago, Illinois, United States Position Type Full-Time/Regular"]

['Already an employee? You must apply through our internal portal: click hereAssociate Marketing ManagerDate: Sep 11, 2019Location:Chicago, IL, US Requisition ID: 8776A Career In BeerOur purpose at MillerCoors a Molson Coors Company is to delight the world’s beer drinkers. We are the world’s family brewer, brewing and selling our beer for over 350 years around the world. We’re TalentBrewers - we believe in our brands and our people, we believe that a truly inspiring and diverse place to work is a must. We want you to join our team of passionate self-starters who believe the world is full of untapped opportunities. So, if you get fired up about making a real difference as part of a winning team like we do, we want to hear from you.The HeadlinesIn the role of Associate Marketing Manager working in Chicago, IL, you’ll help build brands at MillerCoors, which means shaping American culture and changing the way America enjoys beer. You’ll get to operate as a business owner of some of America’s most iconic brands, effectively blending the art & science of marketing–all while having over 300 years of brewing heritage behind you.You will start in one of the following areas: Brand Marketing, Channel/Shopper Marketing or Innovations, and as someone who is enterprise minded, you thrive in building a career within a commercial organization. To help you do this, we have an Associate Marketing Manager Rotational program that focuses on building breadth of marketing experiences in a holistic way.The Responsibilities Providing guidance will be key as you support and direct both internal and external resources in the creation of the brand marketing from concept all the way to completion.  As a strong strategic thinker, you will play a vital role in brand analysis work– including tracking volume, retail data and competitive insights. In marketing, meeting deadlines is of paramount importance. Your clear, cogent direction will facilitate managing, coordinating and orchestrating all the elements of the brand program, including each successive component of the marketing mix.  You will assist in the achievement and tracking of volume, profit and brand health goals.  The Other Qualifications You have a Bachelor’s degree in marketing or business or, better yet, an MBA. Which leaves you perfectly poised to take the next step up into other commercial leadership roles. You have at least 3 years of marketing experience for a Consumer Packaged Goods learning organization; add in sales experience and that could push you over the top. Even with the title of “associate,” you operate with a general manager mindset, and always approach your work as an owner of the business.  You have an innate ability to build empathy with consumers, in particular millennials and diverse consumers.  Your stock answer to the status quo is “No,” plus you constantly challenge the expected to generate new ideas and find opportunities to improve.  “Tenacious” could be your middle name, but “resilient” and “always selling” would work too. You demonstrate conviction and know how to provide and defend a strong point of view.  Work Perks That You Need To Know About As the world’s family brewer, we have the scale to make big things happen and still get to know colleagues on a first name basis across the globe.  We play our part to make a difference – from charitable donations to hitting the streets together to build parks – giving back to the community is part of our culture and who we are.  As a beer enthusiast, you can become a Certified Beer Cicerone through in-house training that includes everything from brewing techniques to beer tasting and food pairings.  Participation in our Total Rewards program with a competitive base salary, incentive plans, parental leave, health, dental and pension benefits.  Work within a fast paced and innovative company, meeting passionate colleagues and partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences At Molson Coors we seek diversity. Differing perspectives lead to challenging the expected, which keeps new ideas bubbling up. We’re an equal opportunity employer and invite applications from candidates from all backgrounds, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic. We take pride in celebrating our unique brew.Nearest Major Market: Chicago']

['Job Description Digital Marketing Analyst We are looking for a Digital Marketing Analyst to work within our Analytics & Insight Team. interpreting trends and providing actionable insights based on available analytics data  Analysing the effect of different online and offline channels on each other and helping to implement strategies for improvement and growth  Analysing online user behaviour, conversion data and customer journeys, funnel analysis and multi-channel attribution  Performing ROI analysis where appropriate to evaluate efficiency and effectiveness of different marketing campaigns  Analytical and Technical  Providing advice on campaign tagging and additional on-site tracking  Spotting potential to implement innovative new methodologies and improve analytical procedure  Using available data sources to deep dive and troubleshoot campaign (and overall) performance issues and propose methodical optimisation tests, both on-site and campaign based  Communication  Collaborating with the design and development teams for on and off-site conversion optimisation projects  Collaborating with the search and social teams to enhance reporting and performance measurement and conduct detailed analysis work when required Key Skills And Experience Experience in working within a marketing/business intelligence environment  High level of experience working with analytical software (e.g. Google Analytics),  High level of experience in data analysis techniques and advanced Excel  High level of experience working with Google Adwords and other paid search platforms  Experience in supporting and validating strategic and tactical marketing objectives  High level of experience in measuring and analysing online marketing campaigns including: natural and paid search, email, affiliate, display and social  Experience in working with website optimisation tools for A/B and multivariate testing, e.g. Google Website Optimizer, Optimizely, etc  Key behaviours  Enthusiastic and self-motivated, with the ability to lead projects proactively  Meticulous attention to detail, with an overall passion for continual improvement  Innovative and creative, with a logical and methodical approach to problem solving  Credible and articulate, with excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills  Ability to relay analytical insight to stakeholders with various levels of analytical and digital knowledge and at all levels of seniority Job Requirements']

Design experience is a plus.Conduct general market research to keep abreast of trends and competitor’s marketing movements.Control budgets and allocate resources amongst projects.Ensure compliance in all safety, health, and environmental regulations, policies and procedures for a goal of zero incidents and injuries.Perform other duties as assigned.Required Experience/Training/EducationBachelor’s Degree in relevant field and 5+ years of experience. 3 years B2B Marketing experience.Required SkillsExpert in B2B inbound marketing: content marketing, social media, SEO and SEMB2B branding expertiseSuccess with building digital funnels: deploying ads, correctly targeting audiences, building landing pages, writing strong calls-to-action and tracking conversionsExperience with Wordpress and ability to make basic website editsGoogle Analytics and Google Ads experience. You will be in charge of attracting site traffic, converting that traffic into new leads for the business, and building and growing our email marketing programs as well as providing knowledge on competitive landscape to better position the company strategically to accelerate its growth even further.The goal of this role is to increase sales leads and brand awareness by creating and executing lead generation campaigns and supporting all aspects of marketing. You will also be responsible for increasing our Company’s social media presence and brand awareness.ResponsibilitiesManage all aspects of email campaigns, supervise staff to produce highly effective email campaigns by focusing on calls-to-action and content used in our email sends.Create a rich content calendar with strategic inbound campaigns designed to fill the sales pipeline regularly.Segment lists in strategic ways to leverage highly targeted messages or past behaviors such as email engagement and website interactions.Grow our prospect database organically.Measure results and optimize the lead nurturing workflows for these segments to convert leads into customers. Develop documentation and road maps for processes, A/B tests and promotions that succeed through email and other social media campaigns.Collaborate with all areas of marketing to ensure strategic campaigns are optimized at every touch point, including website, social media and other.Support the broader marketing function as needed, with branding, awareness, content, trade shows and other activities.RequirementsBA/BS degree with minimum of 5-7 years of relevant work experience. MBA preferred.Past experience with email marketing, lead nurturing, marketing automation and web analytics, proficiency in email marketing and marketing automation technology.Working knowledge of accounting, ERP or financial applications a big plus.Proactive, creative problem solver with an entrepreneurial “can do” work ethic and energetic attitude. Project management skills desired.Excellent writing and communication skills, collaboration and follow-up skills.Highly analytical and able to interpret data and analytics to continually optimize and measure success of marketing campaigns.Proficiency in Microsoft Office products and ability to create documents, presentations, social media posts, creative materials - along with an eagerness to continue learning.Wordpress expertise highly desirable.FYIsoft provides an entrepreneurial environment with excellent benefits including paid holidays and paid time off, a 401(k) Plan with company participation, health and dental insurance, life and disability insurance, a vision discount plan and auto/homeowner insurance discount plan.Only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Any offer of employment will be contingent upon positive background check. No phone calls, please. Principals Only.Drug-free workplace. M/F/V/H EEOAt FYIsoft, we understand the importance of a financial reporting solution and are devoted to building the best. ['Marketing ManagerWe are looking for a Marketing Manager to build, develop, and optimize multi-channel marketing campaigns across our key markets and customers. Successful candidate will possess a passion for marketing, be result-driven and eager to grown and learn in a fast-paced team environment.Primary Responsibilities Include But Not Limited To Develop and implement marketing campaigns across multiple channels with a strong focus on digital, including email marketing, social media, content marketing, and more.  Lead the creation of the integrated marketing plan and strategies for defined verticals, including audience segmentation, marketing tactics, and media mix recommendations.  Create and manage automated nurturing campaigns to generate new leads and increase adoption of current users.  Lead the creation of compelling marketing content and assets to convey the value of our solutions to targeted audiences  Monitor and manage lead and contact flow from marketing to sales to ensure timely and complete follow-ups by appropriate team.  Maintain brand standards to ensure consistent branding and messaging.  Create and promote a library of rich thought leadership content that attracts a qualified audience to our owned properties (including blog posts, whitepapers, ebooks, reports, webinars, infographics, etc.). Ability to quickly grasp complex technical and business concepts and express them in clear language Ability to understand marketing data and analysis while developing plans to adjust tactics from these insights Demonstrated project management skills and proven ability to deliver results in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment Understanding of solution-selling approach into targeted vertical markets. Familiarity working directly with sales teams and sales leadership Exceptional verbal and written communication skills Strong agency management experience A proactive approach to problem identification and resolution A passion for marketing, demand generation and data-driven decision making with a desire to grow and learn Basic RequirementsBachelor in Marketing or related field 5+ years experience developing highly digital integrated marketing communication and demand generations strategies and campaigns in a B2B technology environment Company InformationAnixter International is a leading global distributor of Network & Security Solutions, Electrical& Electronic Solutions and Utility Power Solutions.
